12182.name: Amplitude Event Planner
12182.description:
Quickly create event labels on top of your designs to visually communicate what user actions or events to track. You can easily edit labels, view/hide labels, and export all events as a CSV file or directly to the Amplitude Schema Planner with one click.


How to create a label:

  1. Select the frame or layer you want the event label to outline
  2. Select “Create Event Label” under the Amplitude Event Planner plugin
  3. Describe your event with:
  4. - Event Trigger: when the event should be triggered
  5. - Name: the name of your event (we recommend a verb + noun format)
  6. - Description: descriptive details on when the event is triggered
  7. - Note for Developer: any notes to communicate to the developer, eg. what properties you want to track with the event


We hope this plugin helps designers bring analytics into their design process and streamlines your analytics planning.


If you have any questions or feedback, please file an issue on Github or let us know at platform@amplitude.com.


Additional Resources:

  • Source Code
  • Data Taxonomy Playbook
  • Developers Center
  • Govern & Taxonomy Article

12456.name: i18n
12456.description:
No more manual text layer updates. Just drop your i18n JSON file and update text layers automatically.


How it works

  1. Name text layers with a dot-notation expression such as apps.welcome.title
  2. Start the plugin and drop or select your JSON file.
  3. Text layers with names that match what’s in the JSON file will automatically be updated.


The plugin only accepts the following JSON data structure:

{
  "apps": {
    "welcome": {
      "title": "Happy new year 2021",
      "subtitle": "No more manual text layer updates. Sync your design with your i18n automatically.",
      "cta": {
        "hook": "Miso is good for you.",
        "button": "START"
      }
    }
  }
}
12456.release_notes: Releasing the core function (Importing i18n JSON data and updating text layers accordingly).

12451.name: StyleList – text and color styles
12451.description:
Generate text and color styles quicker and easier way for your projects.


 For text styles generation:

Just enter base size, choose type scale and font settings. Choose sizes that you want and click “Create styles” button. And boom here we go. You just have got all text styles:)


For color styles generation:

We are currently working on this. But if you have any suggestions about how we can make it better don’t hesitate to inbox us on ivandiv13@gmail.com

12477.name: NB Charts
12477.description:
It can be generated Line charts, column charts, bar charts, pie charts, radar charts, maps…


English: www.nbcharts.com

Chinese: www.pslkzs.com/figma/index.php

12715.name: Layer Styles
12715.description:
Save and apply multiple styles at once, including strokes, fills, corner radius, effects and grids.


Create a layer style


  1. Run Plugins > Layer Styles > Show Layer Styles
  2. Select a frame or shape with styles already applied
  3. Click the + in the bottom right of the plugin window


Apply a layer style


  1. Select the layers you would like to apply the layer style to
  2. Click on the layer style in the list to apply that style


Refresh layer styles


After you make a change to a layer style, you can update any layers which were previously applied with this layer style.


  1. Open the plugin
  2. Right-click on the layer style
  3. Click Refresh

12417.name: HCL Easy
12417.description:
Creat advanced palettes for all themes of your design system, taking into account color blindness and contrast.


Color Matrix and Automation

All colors are presented in the form of a matrix. This allows you to create many harmonious palettes for your light and dark themes. You can automatically build Hue, Chroma, and Lightness using Bezier Curves


Color Blindness and Contrast

Using the "Accessibility" function, you can check the entire color matrix for contrast with one form or another of color blindness


Adapted Color Space for Humans

We use the CIELab color space, it allows you to linearly align colors relative to the color perception of a person and the mathematical values ​​of the Hue, Chroma, Lightness axes.


The best start with the bests

We suggest you start creating your own palette based on existing ones, from the most popular design systems of the world

12255.name: 9-Patch export
12255.description:
How to use:

  1. Select at least 1 layer
  2. Go to Plugins -> Android 9-Patch Export

12543.name: Doom Figma
12543.description:
Play Doom in Figma. The game includes the first episode with 9 levels of the most incredible and iconic game in the FPS history.


A far-off moon-base sets the stage as you, the only remaining marine, battle demons, mutant humans, and horrors from the bowels of the universe, to save yourself and the world.


Keyboard Controls


Move     ->    Arrow Keys
Dash     ->    S (Hold)
Run      ->    Shift (Hold)
Open     ->    Spacebar
Shoot    ->    A

Weapons  ->    1 to 7

Confirm  ->    Enter
Menu     ->    Esc


———————————————


Game Credits

License Shareware, Free of charge.

Distributed to public by id Software.

© 1993 - 2021.

Powered by JS-DOS


IDDQD

12169.name: Import React-Icons
12169.description:
Import any* of the many popular icon sets that are included in the react-icons library directly in to your Figma file. The icons will be laid out in a grid, componentised and named in a way that makes it clear to your developers what code they need to write to import the icon from the react-icons library on their end.


https://react-icons.github.io/react-icons/


*The "Game Icons" set has been excluded as otherwise the plugin would exceed the maximum plugin size of 15MB.


Disclaimer: This plugin is not affiliated with the authors of the react-icons library.

12568.name: Doist Utilities
12568.description:
A plugin of utility functions for use with the Doist marketing design system.


It's unlikely that this plugin will be that useful to you since the color styles and components it references are specific to the Doist marketing design system.


Utility functions:

  • set node to parent width/height/both
  • apply basic screenshot styles to image or frame
  • format monochromatic illustrations to be tintable with fills
  • show/hide annotation components
  • resize spacing component using the Marketing spacing scale

12434.name: 9 Slice Scaling
12434.description:
This is a Plugin for 9 slice scaling image from O2 Studio.


The plugin will create a 9 slice scaling component based on the selected image.


Hope it can help your work! enjoy it :)


Developer: Liu,Haiyan & Li,Fanghui

12345.name: Sort on Canvas by Name
12345.description:
Changes positions of frames, components or other objects on canvas by name. Unlike other plugins that only order frames or other layers by name in the layers panel, this plugin can organize them by name on the canvas. However, the plugin will also arrange layers by name if they all belong to one parent element.


Usage

  • Select layers you want to sort. Preferably they should belong to one parent but anything will work. Run the plugin, it will sort your layers.
  • You can also select nothing, in this case plugin will automatically find all frames (only frames) on the page and sort them.


If something is broken or you have feedback, feel free to reach out via support contact on the right side of this page.

12292.name: Copy & Paste Autolayout
12292.description:
Is it possible to copy & paste autolayout parameters alone without other properties? If so then this plugin was a waste of time. If no — enjoy 🥳


Usage:

  1. Select one frame / instance / component
  2. In plugins menu select "Copy & Paste Autolayout"->"Copy Autolayout"
  3. Select another destination frame / instance / component
  4. In plugins menu select "Copy & Paste Autolayout"->"Paste Autolayout"


I'm not a dev, so might be buggy. In case of emergency drop me a message.

12111.name: Memsource Translation Plugin
12111.description: Pseudo-localize pages or submit them to Memsource directly from the Figma environment and retrieved the completed translations.
